segment.source: Windows Defender ATP service onboarding
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP service onboarding

segment.source: Assign users to the Windows Defender ATP service application in Azure Active Directory to grant access to the portal.
segment.target: Assign users to the Windows Defender ATP service application in Azure Active Directory to grant access to the portal.

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP service onboarding
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP service onboarding

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Azure Active Directory
segment.target: Azure Active Directory

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: You have to assign users to the Windows Defender ATP Service application in Azure Active Directory (AAD) before they can access the portal.
segment.target: You have to assign users to the Windows Defender ATP Service application in Azure Active Directory (AAD) before they can access the portal.

segment.source: Manage user access to the Windows Defender ATP portal:
segment.target: Manage user access to the Windows Defender ATP portal:

segment.source: When you first go to the Windows Defender ATP portal and your directory does not have users assigned to the Windows ATP Service application, you will be directed to open the Microsoft Azure Dashboard to manage user access.
segment.target: When you first go to the Windows Defender ATP portal and your directory does not have users assigned to the Windows ATP Service application, you will be directed to open the Microsoft Azure Dashboard to manage user access.

segment.source: Note In AAD, a directory is essentially a tenant.
segment.target: Note In AAD, a directory is essentially a tenant.

segment.source: See the Azure AD documentation for more information on how tenants work with AAD.
segment.target: See the Azure AD documentation for more information on how tenants work with AAD.

segment.source: Ensure you have logged in to Microsoft Azure with an account that has permissions to assign users to an application in AAD.
segment.target: Ensure you have logged in to Microsoft Azure with an account that has permissions to assign users to an application in AAD.

segment.source: You might need to sign out of Microsoft Azure and then sign back in again if you used a different account to sign in to the Windows Defender ATP portal:
segment.target: You might need to sign out of Microsoft Azure and then sign back in again if you used a different account to sign in to the Windows Defender ATP portal:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: On the top menu, click the signed-in user’s name.
segment.target: On the top menu, click the signed-in user’s name.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Click Sign out.
segment.target: Click Sign out.

segment.source: Azure sign out
segment.target: Azure sign out

segment.source: c.
segment.target: c.

segment.source: Go the Microsoft Azure Dashboard again where you will be asked to sign in.
segment.target: Go the Microsoft Azure Dashboard again where you will be asked to sign in.

segment.source: d.
segment.target: d.

segment.source: Sign in with the correct user name and password for an account that has permissions to assign users in AAD.
segment.target: Sign in with the correct user name and password for an account that has permissions to assign users in AAD.

segment.source: On the Microsoft Azure Dashboard, click Browse in the navigation pane and then click Active Directory to open the Azure Management Portal.
segment.target: On the Microsoft Azure Dashboard, click Browse in the navigation pane and then click Active Directory to open the Azure Management Portal.

segment.source: Azure Active Directory menu
segment.target: Azure Active Directory menu

segment.source: You might need to open the Directory section of the Azure Management Portal so you can access your directory.
segment.target: You might need to open the Directory section of the Azure Management Portal so you can access your directory.

segment.source: There are two ways you can do this:
segment.target: There are two ways you can do this:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click the arrow icon above the list of directories to see the full list of directories in the main area of the portal.
segment.target: Click the arrow icon above the list of directories to see the full list of directories in the main area of the portal.

segment.source: Azure organization menu
segment.target: Azure organization menu

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Scroll down in the navigation pane and click Active Directory.
segment.target: Scroll down in the navigation pane and click Active Directory.

segment.source: Azure active directory
segment.target: Azure active directory

segment.source: Click the directory that contains the Windows Defender ATP application.
segment.target: Click the directory that contains the Windows Defender ATP application.

segment.source: In the following example, the directory is called Contoso.
segment.target: In the following example, the directory is called Contoso.

segment.source: Azure active directory list
segment.target: Azure active directory list

segment.source: Note You can also access your directory by going straight to the Azure Management Portal, clicking Active Directory and then finding your directory in the list.
segment.target: Note You can also access your directory by going straight to the Azure Management Portal, clicking Active Directory and then finding your directory in the list.

segment.source: Click Applications from the top menu bar.
segment.target: Click Applications from the top menu bar.

segment.source: Example organization in Azure Active Directory
segment.target: Example organization in Azure Active Directory

segment.source: Click the Windows ATP Service application.
segment.target: Click the Windows ATP Service application.

segment.source: The dashboard for the application is shown.
segment.target: The dashboard for the application is shown.

segment.source: Example selected organization in Azure Active Directory
segment.target: Example selected organization in Azure Active Directory

segment.source: Note The application might have a slightly different name than the one shown here.
segment.target: Note The application might have a slightly different name than the one shown here.

segment.source: It might be called Windows Defender ATP Service.
segment.target: It might be called Windows Defender ATP Service.

segment.source: Click Users from the top menu bar.
segment.target: Click Users from the top menu bar.

segment.source: A list of users that are in the directory is displayed.
segment.target: A list of users that are in the directory is displayed.

segment.source: Example windows atp service users
segment.target: Example windows atp service users

segment.source: Example user assignment to the windows atp service
segment.target: Example user assignment to the windows atp service

segment.source: Note If you do not normally work with AAD, you might not see any users in the directory, or we might have created a test tenant specifically for a single user’s account.
segment.target: Note If you do not normally work with AAD, you might not see any users in the directory, or we might have created a test tenant specifically for a single user’s account.

segment.source: See the Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues section for instructions on adding users to a directory.
segment.target: See the Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues section for instructions on adding users to a directory.

segment.source: Select the user you want manage.
segment.target: Select the user you want manage.

segment.source: Click Assign.
segment.target: Click Assign.

segment.source: Confirm that you want to enable access for the user from the notification bar.
segment.target: Confirm that you want to enable access for the user from the notification bar.

segment.source: If you click Yes, the user is given access to the Windows Defender ATP portal.
segment.target: If you click Yes, the user is given access to the Windows Defender ATP portal.

segment.source: One or more progress bars will appear that indicates the user is being assigned a role, and you will see confirmation messages.
segment.target: One or more progress bars will appear that indicates the user is being assigned a role, and you will see confirmation messages.

segment.source: You don’t need to do anything with the messages, they will go away after a short period of time.
segment.target: You don’t need to do anything with the messages, they will go away after a short period of time.

segment.source: Confirmation page to enable access to users
segment.target: Confirmation page to enable access to users

segment.source: To remove the user's access, click Remove.
segment.target: To remove the user's access, click Remove.

segment.source: Select the Disable access to this app for the selected users checkbox, and then click CompleteComplete icon.
segment.target: Select the Disable access to this app for the selected users checkbox, and then click CompleteComplete icon.

segment.source: One or more progress bars will appear, followed by confirmation messages.
segment.target: One or more progress bars will appear, followed by confirmation messages.

segment.source: The messages will disappear after a short period.
segment.target: The messages will disappear after a short period.

segment.source: Remove menu
segment.target: Remove menu

segment.source: To remove the access for all users, click Manage access.
segment.target: To remove the access for all users, click Manage access.

segment.source: If you click CompleteComplete icon, you will not see the Windows ATP Service in the list of applications in your directory.
segment.target: If you click CompleteComplete icon, you will not see the Windows ATP Service in the list of applications in your directory.

segment.source: Note If you want to give access to users again, see the Manage access for all users in Azure Active Directory topic in Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues.
segment.target: Note If you want to give access to users again, see the Manage access for all users in Azure Active Directory topic in Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues.

segment.source: You can continue assigning roles for other users in your organization now, or you can return to the Windows Defender ATP portal to complete the service onboarding wizard.
segment.target: You can continue assigning roles for other users in your organization now, or you can return to the Windows Defender ATP portal to complete the service onboarding wizard.

segment.source: Note You need to assign roles for every user in your organization that requires access to the Windows Defender ATP portal.
segment.target: Note You need to assign roles for every user in your organization that requires access to the Windows Defender ATP portal.

segment.source: You can assign roles at any time by going to the Azure Management Portal, clicking Active Directory, and then finding your directory in the list and following the steps above.
segment.target: You can assign roles at any time by going to the Azure Management Portal, clicking Active Directory, and then finding your directory in the list and following the steps above.

segment.source: When you have finished assigning roles, return to the Windows Defender ATP portal and refresh the page.
segment.target: When you have finished assigning roles, return to the Windows Defender ATP portal and refresh the page.

segment.source: Follow the steps in the onboarding wizard to complete the onboarding process.
segment.target: Follow the steps in the onboarding wizard to complete the onboarding process.

segment.source: At the end of the wizard, you can download the Group Policy configuration package which you will use to configure endpoints on your network.
segment.target: At the end of the wizard, you can download the Group Policy configuration package which you will use to configure endpoints on your network.

segment.source: You can also download the package from the Client onboarding menu on the portal after you have completed the onboarding wizard.
segment.target: You can also download the package from the Client onboarding menu on the portal after you have completed the onboarding wizard.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Configure Windows Defender ATP endpoints

segment.target: Monitor the Windows Defender ATP onboarding
